messages: c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (20:52): thinks it's a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 turns to be on Standards Suck this week!

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:54): :D
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (20:54): Kill two birds with one stone
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:54): Why? I didn't think I said anything overly controversial‚Ä¶
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:55): Does lastweek monitor #webapps, I wonder
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (20:55): I know, but the fact that you collected all the signatures (except one) constitutes a monumental event! worthy, I hope, of last week in html5

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (20:55): Title: Last Week in HTML5: Geoffrey Snedders, Mrs Last Week salutes you (at lastweekinhtml5.blogspot.com)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:56): (my surname, lastweek and ChrisWilson, is _not_ Snedders, but rather Sneddon)
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (21:01): sounds to me like you need to either change your last name or your irc nick
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:06): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: But gsneddon doesn't sound so cool.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:06): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: And changing my surname would be too much effort.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:07): notes that a number of people here call him a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 in person too
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:07): How do they pronounce the gsn?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:10): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: g‚Ä¢snedders
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (21:10): g is for gangsta.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (21:11): something like that.
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (21:11): at TPAC most folks just referred to you as "'snedders"
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (21:12): I suppose your gangsta credentials were being questioned.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:14): heh. At TPAC timbl tried about two or three names beginning with g before reverting to a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:14): Gregory was first, IIRC
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (21:15): Garfield? Gallagher?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:15): I wasn't really listening
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:15): He was trying to get me attention, and I don't respond to the names he called me :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:15): *my
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:18): I'm not sure what most people call me. I get all sorts of things, often mispronunciations of my name
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:20): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I'd probably argue with you about quite how you pronounce it, knowing the proper Gaelic pronunciation :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:23): can you spell that phonetically?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:23): the -lan bit is obvious
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:24): well, not really. It depends how much stress you put on the A
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:26): You know how loch (as in the Scots/Gaelic word) is pronounced?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:28): [laxl?¶n] I think is the correct IPA
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:29): what? There's no x sound
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:29): x is the "ch" in the Scots/Gaelic "loch"
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:30): oh, ok. Did you just use an x because you didn't have the right character to use?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:30): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: No, I was typing in IPA
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:32): well, assuming I know how to pronounce "loch" correctly, and the x doesn't sound like the x in axe, then I think I do prononce my name correctly
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:33): notes that he knows of nobody who isn't Scottish who quite gets "loch" correct :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:34): I say it something like lock
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (21:34): lock-lenn?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:34): 1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b: no, la- (as in the French la) and not lo-
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (21:35): I doubt you really mean the french la
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:35): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, wtf?
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (21:36): the french la as in lac really doesn't fit
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:36): still stands by [laxl?¶n]
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (21:36): that means nothing to me :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:37): points 1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b at a IPA tutorial :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:37): la in French is [la]
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:37): the ch of "loch" is [x]
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (21:37): I speak french, and none of the french la sounds I know sound right when pronouncing lachlan
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:37): 1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b: Gaelic names often sound odd :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:38): [?¶n] is the "an" in "ban"
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (21:38): hopes people are this detail oriented in their HTML5 test cases. ;-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:39): :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:40): began updating his test cases during TPAC in the HTML WG F2F, and then we went to a lunch break :)
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (21:40): I refuse to believe that the gaelic pronunciation of anything contains either la or l?† from French :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:40): 1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b: :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:42): ah, my IRC client was rending the ?¶ in a font that makes it look like an oe, rather than an ae
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:42): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, http://esl.about.com/library/listening/blIPAvowels.htm says that its pronounced like the a in cat
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (21:42): Title: Correct English Pronunciation Page - IPA Symbols - Audio Examples of English IPA Symbols (at esl.about.com)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:43): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: yeah, that's right too
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:43): then no, you're pronouncing my name wrongly
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:45): If I'm understanding the IPA chart properly, I think it would be more like laxl…ôn
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:46): that would make the second syllable sound like lain
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:48): answers.com says lain is prnounced lƒÅn
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (21:48): It's easier to just say it like "Latch-E"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:48): …ô is like the u in fur
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (21:48): is thankful that his name is easy to pronounce
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:49): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: Like "Same", right? :P
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (21:49): the chart says …ô is like the "a" in "ago"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:50): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mid_central_vowel disagrees :P
